Activities.desc:
Module Overview
In the previous unit, you have learned the importance of Algorithms and Data Structures and the Efficiency and order of growths. Data Structures are broadly classified into Linear Data Structures if the element forms a sequence and Non-linear Data Structures do not form a sequence. So we learn about linear data structures bags, stacks, queues in this module.

Learning Objectives:

  1. Describe Bags
  2. Describe, and implement Stacks
  3. Analyze the complexity of Stacks
  4. Describe, and implement Queues
  5. Analyze the complexity of Queues
  6. Discuss applications of Stacks and Queues

Module Overview
In the previous unit, you have learned the importance of Algorithms and Data Structures and the Efficiency and order of growths. Data Structures are broadly classified into Linear Data Structures if the element forms a sequence and Non-linear Data Structures do not form a sequence. So we learn about linear data structures bags, stacks, queues in this module.

Learning Objectives:

  1. Describe Bags
  2. Describe, and implement Stacks
  3. Analyze the complexity of Stacks
  4. Describe, and implement Queues
  5. Analyze the complexity of Queues
  6. Discuss applications of Stacks and Queues

questionText.text:
Give tilde approximations for all the following quantities:

N + 1

activity_json.title: Assignment - 2
activity_json.text: Assignment-2: Write a program that, given two sorted arrays of N int values, prints all elements that appear in both arrays, in sorted order. The running time of your program should be proportional to N in the worst case. (35 Marks)

activity_json.title: Assignment - 2
activity_json.text: Assignment-2: Write a program that, given two sorted arrays of N int values, prints all elements that appear in both arrays, in sorted order. The running time of your program should be proportional to N in the worst case. (35 Marks)

Activities.desc:
Module Overview
In the previous unit, you have learned the importance of Algorithms and Data Structures and the Efficiency and order of growths. Data Structures are broadly classified into Linear Data Structures if the element forms a sequence and Non-linear Data Structures do not form a sequence. So we learn about linear data structures bags, stacks, queues in this module.

Learning Objectives:

  1. Describe Bags
  2. Describe, and implement Stacks
  3. Analyze the complexity of Stacks
  4. Describe, and implement Queues
  5. Analyze the complexity of Queues
  6. Discuss applications of Stacks and Queues

activity_json.title: Bonus Problem
activity_json.text: Modify binary search so that it always returns the element with the smallest index that matches the search element (and still guarantees logarithmic running time).
